member.name: F:Enterprise.Constants.RequestHeaderConstants.SecChUa
member.summary: The Sec-CH-UA header, short for "Client Hints User-Agent", is part of the User-Agent Client Hints (UA-CH) feature. It provides a more privacy-conscious and structured way for browsers to communicate information about the user's device and browser to web servers.

member.name: F:Enterprise.Constants.RequestHeaderConstants.XForwardedFor
member.summary: The X-Forwarded-For header is used to identify the originating IP address of a client connecting to a web server through an HTTP proxy or load balancer.

member.name: F:Enterprise.Constants.RequestHeaderConstants.XClientSslProtocol
member.summary: The x-client-ssl-protocol header is often used to specify the SSL/TLS protocol version that a client used to establish a connection. This can be useful for logging, analytics, or enforcing security policies.
